Converts a RDF value to a request string, requesting a specific view to open (e.g. "wiki"). As specifically requested URIs override session parameters, RequestMapper.getRequestStringFromValue(Value) should normally be preferred.

normalize

public java.lang.String normalize(java.lang.String name)
Specified by:
normalize in interface RequestMapper
Returns:
a normalized name When generating URIs from names, we try to follow best practices such that - we assure compatibility with other tools - avoid URI chaos and thus making integration easier - make it easier for a user to use short names The best practices are derived from the behavior in MediaWiki, DBpedia and the like Best practices include: - do not use whitespace in URIs, replace with _ (see MediaWiki) - encode special characters - (to be completed)

getAHref

public java.lang.String getAHref(org.openrdf.model.Value value,
                                 java.lang.String label,
                                 java.lang.String tooltip)
Description copied from interface: RequestMapper
Create a hyperlink to the resource specified by value using the provided label. Note: the plain label is return if value is not a Resource and literals shall not be rendered as links (see com.fluidops.iwb.util.Config.getConfig().getLinkLiterals()) Both label and tooltip will get html encoded

Specified by:
getAHref in interface RequestMapper
label - the label (not html encoded)
tooltip - a tooltip or null
Returns:
a hyperlink for the resource or the plain label

getAHrefEncoded

public java.lang.String getAHrefEncoded(org.openrdf.model.Value value,
                                        java.lang.String encodedLabel,
                                        java.lang.String encodedTooltip)
Description copied from interface: RequestMapper
Create a hyperlink to the resource specified by value using the provided label. Note: the plain label is return if value is not a Resource and literals shall not be rendered as links (see com.fluidops.iwb.util.Config.getConfig().getLinkLiterals()) IMPORTANT: the label has to be urlEncoded, use StringEscapeUtils#escapeHTML(String)

Specified by:
getAHrefEncoded in interface RequestMapper
encodedLabel - the (html encoded) label
encodedTooltip - a (html encoded) tooltip or null
Returns:
a hyperlink for the resource or the plain label

getInternalUrlWithoutContext

public java.lang.String getInternalUrlWithoutContext(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
Description copied from interface: RequestMapper
Returns a URL that can be used by the server to locate itself. The returned URL does not contain a context-path, but just the plain server locator: [protocol]://[server name]:[server port] (without trailing '/') If Config.getInternalHostUrl() is set, that is returned, otherwise the server-locator is read from the request.

Specified by:
getInternalUrlWithoutContext in interface RequestMapper
Parameters:
request - the URL is built from, if Config.getInternalHostUrl() is not set.
Returns:
A server-locator.

getInternalUrl

public java.lang.String getInternalUrl(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                       java.lang.String path)
Description copied from interface: RequestMapper
Returns a complete URL that can be used by the server to access itself. This returns the same as RequestMapper.getExternalUrl(HttpServletRequest, String), if Config.getInternalHostUrl() is empty. Otherwise the URL is built in the following way: Config.getInternalHostUrl()/[context path from request]/path

Specified by:
getInternalUrl in interface RequestMapper
Parameters:
request - The request the returned URL is built from
path - The path (after context-path) the returned URL should refer to
Returns:
a complete URL referencing a resource of the web application

getExternalUrl

public java.lang.String getExternalUrl(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                       java.lang.String path)
Description copied from interface: RequestMapper
Returns a complete URL-string built from the passed request and the path-string. Since this URL is built from the request, the client that sent the request should be able to access with the returned URL a resource of the same web-application. The URL is built in the following way: [protocol from request]://[server name from request]:[server port from request]/[context path from request]/path

Specified by:
getExternalUrl in interface RequestMapper
Parameters:
request - The request the returned URL is built from
path - The path (after context-path) the returned URL should refer to
Returns:
a complete URL referencing a resource of the web-application

getExternalUrlWithoutContext

public java.lang.String getExternalUrlWithoutContext(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                                     java.lang.String path)
Description copied from interface: RequestMapper
Same as RequestMapper.getExternalUrl(HttpServletRequest, String), except that path is assumed to already contain a context path (of a potentially different web application). So the context path of the request is simply left out, when building the URL.

Specified by:
getExternalUrlWithoutContext in interface RequestMapper
Parameters:
request - The request the returned URL is built from
path - The path (including context-path) the returned URL should refer to
Returns:
a complete URL referencing a resource of web-application on the same server

getSearchUrlForValue

public java.lang.String getSearchUrlForValue(java.lang.String searchQuery)
Description copied from interface: RequestMapper
Returns the URL that can be used to search for a given query, i.e. either a keyword query or a SPARQL query. A valid security token is also attached within this method. By default, searches over structured data (i.e., not wiki pages) Example /%CP%/search/?q=searchQuery&st=%securityToken%

Specified by:
getSearchUrlForValue in interface RequestMapper
Parameters:
searchQuery - a keyword or a SPARQL query (NOT url encoded)
Returns:

getSearchUrlForValue

public java.lang.String getSearchUrlForValue(java.lang.String searchQuery,
                                             java.util.List<java.lang.String> queryTargets)
Description copied from interface: RequestMapper
Returns the URL that can be used to search for a given query, i.e. either a keyword query or a SPARQL query. A valid security token is also attached within this method. searchTargets specify target repositories to search. Pre-defined values are WIKI (for wiki search), and RDF (for the main semantic data repository). For specific types of search targets, the class name of the corresponding SearchProvider class has to be given. If several values are specified, search results over different targets are merged. Example /%CP%/search/?q=searchQuery&st=%securityToken%

Specified by:
getSearchUrlForValue in interface RequestMapper
Parameters:
searchQuery - a keyword or a SPARQL query (NOT url encoded)
Returns:
